channel.title: Friends list
channel.description:
Where would I find data on the friends list to change? Say...I'm making an akf command...And I want it to say "AFK" instead of online when they are afk. But, I cannot seem to find anything on it.
Thanks, -Set

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

You could make a client sided command, but that would only change for you.

Plus that is what I said, make the command send the value of the player to everyone that they are afk, which would be a different value than online or offline.

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:4, topic:286507”][/quote]
Oh, well. Thanks…Found it…Any idea what to add?

if(anIntArray826[j] == 10) class9.aString248 = "@gre@Online"; else if(/*anIntArray826[j] == anInt957*/anIntArray826[j] == 1) class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; else class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; class9.anInt217 = 1; return; }
[/quote]

I have a better idea? Create a new part to anIntArray826[j], so its not 10 its 11 or somthing, and than make it so that when you do ::afk it makes that 11 and convert it like this?

if(anIntArray826[j] == 11) class9.aString248 = "@yel@AFK"; else if(/*anIntArray826[j] == anInt957*/anIntArray826[j] == 1) class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; else class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; class9.anInt217 = 1; return; }
And to save confusion… couldnt you make the afk command client sided? Im not 100% sure, like Set, Im not a client sided person, but i know you can make commands on hte client side

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Bryanc:

That is on the client, I am talking about on the server where it sends the values to the client. The value that tells the client whether or not the player is on.

Hmm, don’t really know what to erm…Look for.

@newty I could…But, where’s the fun in that?

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Or you could be lazy and do it a different way. It will still say online but if the player is AFK it will send the player who sent the message a message that say’s the other person is afk.

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:4, topic:286507”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=378908.msg2849879#msg2849879 date=1246479243]
Well, That may be because its client sided not server sided? Its some of both, but online off line are client sided I belive
[/quote]
Oh, well. Thanks…Found it…Any idea what to add?

if(anIntArray826[j] == 10) class9.aString248 = "@gre@Online"; else if(/*anIntArray826[j] == anInt957*/anIntArray826[j] == 1) class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; else class9.aString248 = /*"@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9)*/"@red@Offline"; class9.anInt217 = 1; return; }[/quote]

?

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

I don’t have any server sources for reference, but just find where the statuses are sent to the client. Just look about in client.java, probably would take a while, and I am too lazy to get a source right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Bryanc:

You would need to make the server send the client a different value instead of the default things. Then add that in, but then you have problems because if the some players don’t use your client it won’t show. Possibly, depending on how you do it, it could also crash.

Any idea where/how to go about doing this? Sorry. Terrible with client sided shiz.

Read full topic

item.title: Friends list
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

You would need to make the server send the client a different value instead of the default things. Then add that in, but then you have problems because if the some players don’t use your client it won’t show. Possibly, depending on how you do it, it could also crash.

Read full topic
